Name: C⁴KISR System: Information Warfare Under High-Tech Conditions
Description: A game of modern military exercise based on information processing system integrating C4KISR (command/control/communications/computer/kill/intelligence/reconnaissance/surveillance).

Name: Recapture the Country
Description: A game of fictional battle during the 2nd Sino-Japanese War, based on a Chinese TV drama broadcasted in 2014. The first game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.

Name: Brothers' War 1983: East Germany VS. West Germany
Description: An wargame on hypothetical battle between East Germany and West Germany in 1983. The second game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.

Name: Cirquarles
Description:
In Cirquarles players try to place 4 pieces with matching properties in a line.

Components

        24 pieces (2 identical sets of 12 unique pieces in white and black colors)
        1 game board


Setup
Each player receives 12 unique pieces of one color and arranges them in 4 stacks on own side, close to the game board.

How to play
Players alternate turns starting with the player who controls the white pieces.

Type of pieces
Each unique piece is cut out in the middle and defined by three different properties affecting the gameplay:

        piece size: small, medium or large 
        interior shape of a piece: square or circle
        exterior shape of a piece: square or circle


Players actions
During player’s turn player may perform one of 2 actions:

        place a new piece on the board, or
        move a piece on the board to a new field (Players cannot remove pieces from the board once they have been deployed)


Pieces movement
A player may only move pieces of own color. Player is allowed to only take and move the exterior piece of the stack. Even if other pieces are placed inside. Pieces surrounded by the opponent's one cannot be moved. They are blocked at the moment.

Players can place their pieces:

        to any empty field on the gameboard
        inside/outside of the other pieces (own or opponent’s), if it can be placed without collision.


If a piece cannot be placed without collision on a field, then player cannot place it there.

Game End
A player wins the game immediately after placing 4 pieces with matching properties in a line (horizontal, vertical, oblique)

—description from the designer

Name: Battle of Talas
Description:
An wargame on the Battle of Talas, a military engagement between the Abbasid Caliphate along with its ally, the Tibetan Empire, against the Chinese Tang dynasty in 751 AD.

The third game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.

Name: Paris Deception: Battle of Gaullism
Description: A wargame on hypothetical battle between NATO and France seceding from NATO. The fourth game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series and a sequel to Brothers' War 1983: East Germany VS. West Germany (series #2).

Name: Battle of Shanggao
Description: An wargame on the Battle of Shanggao in 1941 during the Second Sino-Japanese War. The fifth game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.

Name: Great Retreat
Description: An wargame on the First Battle of the Marne in 1914 during World War I.

Name: Schneller mit Glitzi, schneller zum Ziel!
Description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Pot o' Gold II
Description:
In Pot o' Gold II players compete to win four pots of unknown value.

Each of the pots is initially seeded with three face cards from one of two standard decks of cards. The remainder of these cards are used to play the game - each player receives a hand of ten.

On a turn a player plays any non-face card to a central pile; when the total value of the cards reaches 20 the player causing this gets an action (or two if they hit 20 exactly). Actions include placing a marker on a pot, moving a marker, looking at the cards in a pot, adding a face card to a pot, or re-rolling the die placed next to each pot, which will later subtract from its value.

Play continues until two players have each used all five of their markers, at which point the pots are scored. The player with the most markers on a pot gets the full value, the player with the second most gets half value. The value of a pot is based on the die, the number of markers, and the cards in it.

Name: The Game of Flying Obelisks
Description:
The Game of Flying Obelisks is played on a 9x9 board with two raised 3x3 "hills." Each player has a set of 17 pieces of 8 different types, and there are also 5 neutral obelisks.

On a turn a player moves a piece according to its specific movement rules. Moving to a space occupied by an enemy piece captures it. Moving to a space occupied by a friendly piece creates a stack; a stack can have up to three pieces (with some restrictions) and can move as any of the pieces in it.

By moving pieces to the opposite rank a player may recover lost pieces or acquire obelisks. Obelisks allow stacks they are with to teleport from one hill to the other. (Movement onto and on hills is fairly restricted.)

The object of the game is to capture the opposing globe (which moves like a Chess king) or to occupy both hilltops (the center squares of the hills) and have no enemy pieces on the hills.

Note: this was claimed to be a reconstruction of an ancient board game, but that was an April Fool's joke.

Name: Dollar
Description:
Dollar is played with two decks of standard playing cards minus the court cards (one for each player) plus a supply of 199 points in tokens worth specific amounts (e.g. US coins).

Players have four-card hands and play "tricks" to win points; players each play one card with no restrictions and the higher card wins a token (which one depends on specific conditions). If there is a tie a token is added to the next trick, unless the cards are identical in which case the second player wins 25 points.

The object is to reach 100 points.

Name: The Ring
Description:
The Ring is a card game loosely based on the US election process. It is played using a standard deck of cards, a small board, and some markers.

The game is driven by four columns of cards on the table, which each start with a single card. On a turn a player can draw a card from the deck, add a card to a column, or discard a card allowing them to take one or more columns: columns with a total exactly matching the discarded card and/or any combination of columns matching this may be taken.

For each column taken the player places a marker in the top box of an area on the events board (or five markers if they manage to take all four columns at once). There is a marker moving from area to area with each placement, so a player placing multiple markers places them in different areas.

Once all the spaces on the board are full the game ends. Players each one point per marker, except that markers on blue spaces are worth two. A player having the majority of the spaces in an area doubles their points for it. Players lose points for cards in hand. If there is a tie for overall points the lowest player is dropped and the board is re-assessed.

Name: ASL Comp: Cambrai II – Black Friday: Fontaine
Description:
Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... this is a limited collection and print run.

Cambrai II – Black Friday: Fontaine is a GWASL Module and includes BONUS publishers choice counters, special rules and 8 scenarios set on the historical map provided.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 required.

Scenarios:
Fontaine-Notre-Dame, Nord, France

     As Darkness Falls, November 21st 1917
     Forlorn Hope, November 21st 1917
     Securing The Flank, November 23rd 1917
     Black Friday, November 23rd 1917
     Harper’s Duds, November 23rd 1917
     Winter Quarters, November 27th 1917
     Nulli Secundus, November 27th 1917
     Kilted Canucks, September 28th 1917

Name: Shit Happens: Shitty Ways to Die
Description:
These cards are full of really bad situations, but you have to sort them according to the level of how bad the way of dying is.

All players start the game with 3 cards laid out in front of them. The player to the right of the starting player reads out a card from the draw pile. The starting player must then decide where the card fits into their set of cards according to the misery rating. If they guess correctly, they add the card to their set. Answer incorrectly and the player to their left may try.

Arrange 10 cards correctly to win the game.

Name: Malleus 1666
Description:
Malleus 1666 is a cooperative dungeon crawler board game for 1 to 3 players. In this game players control heroes intended to prevent the evil awakens from his ancient sleep.

This game uses dice for player attacks and cards for monster actions. You must explore room by room, complete missions, collect equipment (by destroying barrels) and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Alsace
Description:
The famous trivia game.

The questions are about the region of Alsace in North-est France.

3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geography, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.

Name: Theatre in a Box: Return Season
Description:
The Return Season expansion is another 220+ cards to immerse yourself. This pack contains more singing, more dancing, more acting, more trivia and even more tears and cheers.

—description from the designer

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Alsace
Description:
Discover or rediscover the region of Alsace in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Questions in 6 different themes: 

     History, 
     entertainment , 
     Geography, 
     Art and Literature, 
     Science and Nature, 
     Sports and Leisure.

Name: Imperial Glory
Description:
The player manages the Ancient Kushan Empire of India and Central Asia in the years 50-220 CE.

Using a deckbuilding system, each player has a deck of advisors including generals, governors, diplomats, artists, architects, philosophers and secret agents. Each type allows distinct types of actions. The player can accept the initial card draw, or push their luck by spending precious influence hoping to draw a card the empire needs more.

After determining the action, the player allocates funds (talents) and determines the result via random draw of a result counter. But in the case of invasion, a more elaborate sequence plays out on the Battle Board using a brand new combat resolution system.

Based on how well the turn went, the emperor gains or loses an unknown number of popularity points, the player keeps or loses influence points, and gains or loses an advisor.

Finally, players draw one of the momentous Fate cards, which can even lead to the death of the emperor. When this occurs, popularity converts to influence and cards enter and leave the deck based on the differing interests of the new emperor. When the last emperor dies, the game ends and the player scores points based on the empire's achievements at that time, conquests, but also cultural achievements and economic development.

Features named emperors with historical stats and descriptions, a wide array of army types, army maintenance, unrest, rebellion, nonplayer barbarians, civil wars, heresy, pandemic, trade, temples, monuments, aqueducts, roads, rules to control a nonplayer in combat, and more.

This is the first in a series of games to eventually include the ancient Roman, Parthian and Han Chinese empires, each player having to cope with the game system as well as each other.

-description from designer

Name: ASL Comp: Cambrai III – A Panorama of Hell Bourlon
Description:
Cambrai III – A Panorama of Hell Bourlon is a GWASL Module and includes BONUS publishers choice counters, special rules and 8 scenarios set on the historical map provided.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 and 2 required.

Scenarios:
Bourlon, Pas-de-Calais, France

     A Day Out – November 23rd 1917
     Stick Close, But Not Too Close – November 23rd 1917
     Remember Spion Kop – November 23rd 1918
     Hold Or Die – November 23rd 1918
     Mighty Little Men – November 24th 1917
     Arwyr Bach – November 24th 1917
     Hell’s Last Issue – November 24th 1917
     Hunting Party – November 25th 1917

Name: Don't Let It Die: Hindrance
Description:
For as long as anyone can remember, the nearby mountains have been covered in a thick layer of ice, making it impossible to climb. So it comes as a surprise to the group when you see the ice has melted away, revealing the rocky exterior and unlocking the mountains precious resources for those brave enough to ascend its dangerous terrain.

The Hindrance expansion brings the following new features and content to the game. You can find the Hindrance logo on either the front or the back of the new content to help identify it.

This is an expansion for Don't Let It Die and includes...

- 4 Unique characters, some with special items and tokens.

- 16 new Night Event cards.

- 24 Hindrance cards.

- 32 new Discoveries to modify the Fire Knowledge Tree.

- 3 new Resource types (Gemstones, Eggs and Herbs)

- A new Resource deck, Explore.

- 14 new Weapons, Tools and Buildings.

-description from designer

Name: Semino
Description:
Semino is a game of chance and strategy. Victory goes to the player who can grow their plant the quickest.

—description from the back of the box

Each player rolls a die and moves their bamboo tube across a grid, collecting marbles in the bottom. Each marble collected pushes colored leaves up to the top until it fully blooms.

Two difficulty levels are included:

      Players may collect marbles of any color.
      Players can collect marbles only of their own color.


—user summary

Name: Liar's Clue
Description:
Liar's Clue is played using six number and six court cards from a standard deck and a reference sheet for each player. Six hands each consisting of one number and one court card are dealt: one to each player, one face-down on the table, and one face-up on the table. The object of the game is to deduce the cards in the face-down table hand.

On a turn a player asks an opponent any question about their hand that they want, as long as it can be answered with "yes" or "no." However, the player being questioned does not necessarily tell the truth - the reference sheet tells them whether to tell the truth or to lie, based on which number card they have and which player is asking the question.

Name: Halloween Hustle
Description:
Halloween Hustle is played with a standard deck of cards and a supply of candy (or other small items).

At the start of each hand each player receives four cards and a supply of candy is placed in the center of the table: one less than the number of players.

The dealer draws a card from the deck and then passes any of their cards to the player on their left, who then passes any card to the next player, and so on; the player to the right of the dealer ends up discarding a card. In the meantime the dealer draws and passes another card, so players end up all passing cards at the same time. Discards are shuffled when the deck runs out.

When a player has four cards of the same rank they take a piece of candy. All other players may then also take a piece. Starting on the second round the player left without a piece is eliminated from the game. After a player is eliminated, of one player has more candy than anyone else they win. Otherwise another hand is played.

A player may pretend to be about to take a piece of candy to fake out other players. If another player takes a piece in this case, they must give it back along with a piece they already have.

Variant rules are provided for younger children.

(The game says up to 13 players can play, but there's no way to get the game started in that case.)

Name: ASL Comp: Operation Lens Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare
Description:
Operation Lenz Nord was conducted April 4th through April 13th 1943, in the area around Borisov, in the Gavja river valley, some of the actions involved the villages of Korkeyka, Zarinek, Starniki, Dworzez, and Zabashevichi. 
The area was thick forest, swamps, peat bogs, and many of the little villages were on low hills, like islands among the bogs and water logged forests.  
Home the Partisan Regiment “Bolshevik” the Germans found a challenging adversary in the vast formidable terrain of central Russia.

Operation Lenz Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare updates the map and situations from the former "Bandenkreig"

Ownership of ASL-RB, CH's NATIONALITY Sets providing Waffen SS and Partisans - AND ownnership of any editions of modules that provide 5-2-7/3-3-7 Russians and 5-4-8/4-4-7 SS MM

Scenarios:

     When the Odds were Even - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 12th 1943
     Death’s Magnet - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
     Ivan’s Farm - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 11th 1943
     Chaos in Haste - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, July 1st 1944
     Swamped with Partisans - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 9th 1943
     The Road to Orsha – Outside Orsha, Soviet Union, June 24th 1944
     Defeat in the Peat - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
     Derbun’s Command Post - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 13th 1943

1514 the board game, was designed to mark the 500th anniversary of the Battle of Orsha.

1514 is an epic board game for two, four or six players.

Become the head of the Muscovite army or forces of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. 
Roll the dice, move your troops, take part in battles and follow orders from the cards. 
Tactics and luck, combine infantry, cavalry and artillery regiments and win the victory!

The game must involve an even number of people - 2, 4, 6:

     2 : players go in turns, one kind of troops per turn (for example, the first move of player â„–1 - infantry, the second move - cavalry, the third move - artillery, then again infantry, etc.).
     4 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscow army and the Lithuanian army. Artillery figures are not involved in this version of the game, so one player controls one type of troops. The game takes turns (for example, the first move of player â„–1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player â„–2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player â„–3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player â„–4 for the Lithuanian cavalry).
     6 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscovite army and the Lithuanian army. Each player controls one kind of troops. The game takes place alternately (for example, the first move of player â„–1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player â„–2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player â„–3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player â„–4 for the Lithuanian cavalry, the fifth move of player â„– 5 for the Moscow artillery, the sixth move - player â„–6 for the Lithuanian artillery).


Gameplay:
In your turn, roll the dice and move your figure to the number of points received. Subsequent game actions depend on where you are on the field. 
Troops of one army can stand on one space. 
If, after throwing the dice, your figure ends in a space with an enemy troops, a "Battle" begins.
When on the red or black box, take a card of the appropriate color and follow the steps described in it. If, as a result of the orders executed on the card, you are again on the red or black field, you do not need to take the card a second time.

Combat:
If you receive a "Fight!" Card, then your moving figure and the nearest (on either side) opponent's figure start the fight. You and your opponent roll the dice at once - who gets more points wins. The defeated army that took part in the battle goes as many steps back as the points thrown by the winner during the battle. In case of a tie the combat is held again, until victory.

Victory:
The winner is the one who first brings to the enemy's camp his entire army, of figures of infantry, cavalry and artillery.

Name: Petrichor: Collector's Edition
Description:
Petrichor is the earthy scent produced when rain falls on dry soil. The word is constructed from Greek (πÎ­τρα) petra, meaning "stone", and (á¼°χÏŽρ) Ä«chÅr, the fluid that flows in the veins of the gods in Greek mythology.

Welcome to the lush world of Petrichor; you are a cloud. Your entire purpose in life is to expand, sire other clouds and water crops. Unfortunately, your mates (who are also clouds) have a similar plan. It’s up to you to manipulate the weather and assimilate these rogue clouds to contribute to the growth of as many crops as possible - all in order to claim the title of Most Valuable Cloud.

Petrichor is a highly interactive board game, playable by 1-4 people (up to 5 with the expansion, see below). It’s an action selection/area influence game, with 4 simple actions which interact with the various fields in ever surprising ways. The players move clouds with water droplets, and then rain those droplets onto specific fields, to make sure they have the right amount of water for the Harvest. During a Harvest, crops that have been watered enough are scored! Players are able to influence when, and how often the harvest happens. Players need to strike a fine balance between maintaining control of the different fields as well as influencing Harvest, to make sure the two come together at the optimal time.

This Collector's Edition comes with a new Artwork and includes the Flower, Honeybee, Greener Pasture Expansion.

Name: Minderheiten Quartett
Description:
This satirical card game features 60 minorities structured in 10 groups. Earlier editions are completely revised.

Minderheiten Quartett is a variant of a Quartett game, with a splash of Top Trumps and some unique mechanisms thrown in. There are two types of cards. First, the traditional Top Trumps style cards with minorities and their statistics, such as intelligence or sex appeal. Second, there are 6 Joker Cards which may change the scoring.

Every player receives 3 minorities cards and a joker. The starting player defines a category and "low" or "high". All players choose a card simultaneously. The player with the highest score chooses 2 of the played cards and puts them on his victory pile. All other players except the last one choose one card. Players then restock their hand to three cards. The game ends when one player has 4 cards of the same minority in his victory pile. This player wins.
A variant suggests to find the most discriminated person by discussion.

Name: Root: The Clockwork Expansion 2
Description:
Root: The Clockwork Expansion 2 adds four new automated opponents. Compete against the:


     Logical Lizards



     Riverfolk Robots



     Cogwheel Corvids



     Drillbit Duchy


Also, it contains new trait cards to spice up the factions from the first Clockwork expansion. To use this product, you must have the Underworld and/or Riverfolk Expansions.

Electric Eyrie board with fixed rules is included as well.

Name: Domino Bagger, Lok & Co.
Description:
With backhoe, locomotive, fire truck, shovel loader, tractor, dump truck, and concrete mixer there are seven different vehicles in this domino type game. In each case, the same motifs are placed next to each other. Who has the matching vehicles and manages to be the first to put all his domino cards?

The game is played clockwise, starting with the youngest player. On your turn, you look to see if you can match one of your tiles with one of the tiles in the middle of the table. The tiles can only be placed at the two open ends of the domino queue. Only identical motifs may be placed, for example, locomotive to locomotive or concrete mixer to concrete mixer.

If you have a matching tile, you may place it. Then it's the next player's turn.
If you don't, you must take a tile from the draw pile. If this tile you just took is a match, then you may place it on the table immediately.

The game ends when a player has played all tiles. The game also ends when none of the players can place a card. The winner is the player who has the fewest cards left.

Name: Root: Riverfolk Hirelings Pack
Description:
Need allies? Come row downstream! Discover unique strategies and make the Woodland wilder by adding hirelings. Best with fewer players, great with more!

This product contains six new hirelings:
- Riverfolk Flotilla and Otter Divers
- Warm Sun Prophets and Lizard Envoys
- Highway Bandits and Bandit Gangs

Hirelings can be added to games at any player count. With fewer players, the hirelings add new pieces to the map, ramping up the tension and giving you more tactical options. With more players, some hireling cards will flip over to reveal new special abilities to gain, letting you explore unique and powerful strategies.

Name: Root: Landmarks Pack
Description:
Bring the Root Woodland to life with landmarks! Landmarks add unique powers to their clearings and can be added to games with any player count.

The Landmark Pack includes four screen-printed wood landmarks:
Barter for anything you need at the Black Market.
Find new friends and followers in the Lost City.
Craft a masterwork at the Legendary Forge.
Sit proud upon the grand throne in the Elder Treetop.

Name: Mad for War: Essentials
Description:
The core rules for Mad for War. This is a pre release version enabling players to get used to the system.
Everything you need to get Mad for War on the tabletop including templates and overhead plans of ships which can be cut out and used to play the game, and lots of dice!
Mad for War is a new rule system covering miniature gaming with models ships. It focuses on the 17th century when world domination depended on having a powerful navy.

Name: Ruination: The World That Was
Description: Ruination: The World That Was is an expansion comprised of all of the stretch goals unlocked during the Ruination KS campaign. This expansion adds the option to play Ruination as a solo game.

Name: Colorbs
Description:
In Colorbs, you’ll try to build the most efficient grid of colorful energy-orbs (colorbs) possible.
Players take turns building and harvesting colorbs.        
Some colorbs have special abilities that makes them worth more points when combined with others in a pattern.
The player with the most points when a grid of 4x3 orbs is full or there is no cards left in the colorb-deck wins the game.

Name: Sight Words Challenge Grade 1: Sled Spin Out! Board Game
Description:
A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency!

Includes: 
Game board with 40 sight words
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 pawns and one die

conforms to ASTM D-4236

OBJECT: Be the first player to complete all of the sentences on your game card.

SETUP: Have each player choose a game card, a pawn, and a write & Wipe marker.

HOW TO PLAY: Place your pawn on the "start" space and roll the die to decide who will go first.  Whoever rolls the highest number starts, and play proceeds to the left.
To play, roll the die and move your pawn that many spaces along the board.
When you land on a space, say the word aloud then look over your game card to see if you can use the word in one of the sentences on your game card.
If you can use the word, write it on your card with the marker, then read the sentence aloud.  Players should decide whether the word makes sense in the sentence.  If you cannot use the word, play passes to the next player.

HOW TO WIN: The first player to complete all of his or her sentences is the winner!  Continue moving around the board until someone wins, even if you pass the start space.

Name: Secret Room: Mord in der Villa Dornbirn
Description:
NOTES - Detectives, your help is needed! Searches 35 paper documents for clues, motives and alibis and finds out together why Mr. Luger had to die.
TENSION - The victim's video message and other digital web content turn the detective game into a multimedia puzzle game for the whole family and friends.
INVESTIGATORS - Thanks to the involvement of real murder investigators and real locations, the parlor game promises an exciting story and a unique adventure.
INTERNET - The crime thriller game is suitable for up to 8 players, ages 14+. You need internet access and an email address to solve the murder case.
INSTRUCTIONS - You can immediately follow the trail of the perpetrator - without any instructions! The exciting Escape Room game is also perfect as a gift for crime fans.

Name: Dial the Dice: Fantasy Edition
Description:
Dial dice, not roll, to activate moves and skills for your hero pawns on the game board. First player to complete 12 hero tasks wins the game.

This game is a stand alone board game AND also has a modular element allowing players to play their DtD heroes through their favorite RPG module.

—description from the designer

Name: Tit Albert dans Villaz
Description:
Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is a fascinating and extremely simple game system!
The peaceful Vilaz is invaded by the Tit'Albert who devour the Vilazwas one by one.
If no one reacts, it is otut le Vilaz that is threatened! The game continues until the Tit'Alberts are eliminated or the Vilaz is emptied of its inhabitants.

A turn-based game alternating day / night cycles, the story of Vilaz is told by the Storyteller, who will put the Vilaz to sleep and wake up the actors of this story to play a specific role in this confrontation between the players.
Play as a Tit'Albert to eat the Vilazwas or Cliffeeeeurd the White Hunter, take the lead of the Vilaz by becoming the Sef'Vilaz and eliminate every day a player you suspect to be a Tit'Albert.

Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is based on Mauritian folklore which describes the myth of the werewolf. Each character in the game comes from local folklore and represents an icon from Mauritian culture.

—description from the designer

Name: Flames of War: Bagration – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1944
Description:
Bagration: German is the third German themed book in the Flames Of War Late-war series of army handbooks (after D-Day: German and D-Day: Waffen-SS). 
It is also the second of the Bagration series, bringing you German Eastern Front forces fighting against Soviet Operation Bagration as featured in Bagration: Soviet.

Bagration: German covers the German forces fighting all across the Eastern Front from Finland in the north to Romania and Hungary in the south from January 1944 to January 1945.

There is a great variety of formations and units available to field, from tanks and armoured infantry to grenadiers and tank-hunters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rätselraum Stories: Teil 1 – Rätselhafte Spuren
Description: After a mysterious message, Tanja is very worried about her brother. The normally very reliable Philipp hasn't answered for hours, which is why Tanja goes looking for him. When Tanja follows Philip's lead, she comes across unsettling information. Will you be able to support her on her journey and find her brother?

Name: Flames of War: German Starter Force – Tank-Hunter Kampfgruppe
Description:
Reinforce your German troops on the eastern front.
Nothing beats a Tank-Hunter Kampfgruppe to stop the Soviet advance, or at least try.

Name: TERXO
Description:
Terxo is an abstract alignment game, the more innovative tic tac toe evolution.

(1)build a 3x3x3 cube: at the end, the player who score more points is the winner of the match!

Each dice is different from the others, everyone have a specific Dice-Color, an impressed Sign, and Sign-Color)

(2)You score a point when 3 pieces are sharing one characteristic in common (same dice color, same sign, or same color of the sign)

(3)Aligments Are allowed in every linear direction throw the cube

(4)You can score more than one point at the same time, for example, if you score in more than one direction or two characteristics on the same direction.

Players doesn't have specific pieces, but the avaible pieces and the building cube are for all.

(5)at each turn you receive the piece you have to play from the previous player.
After positioning your piece and declared how many points you score, you have to chose from the avaible dices the next dice you want to give to the next player!

(6) each piece has to be placed in contact with pieces already placed (contact by placed above, on the side or by corner).

This way you never know, from the start, in which direction the cube will develop.
 (7) Do not position pieces over the third dimension (by sides or hight)… The final shape must still be a cube.

(8) Pieces can not to be moved after being placed.

(9)   2 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2
      3 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2 VS Pl.3 
      4 players - (Pl.1 & Pl.3) VS (Pl.1 & Pl.3)
(in 4, players plays in two teams with alternated players)

Terxo, This Board Less Board Game is a complete information game with high strategy and easy rules

—description from the designer

Name: NetWords
Description:
NetWords is a word game played using only paper and pencil. No maximum number of players is given.

The game starts with an agreed-upon number of letters, each written in a circle, with the circles connected by lines. The players also agree on the number of letters that will end the game and the minimum word length.

On a turn a player may add as many connections as they want between existing letters that aren't already connected, as long as none of the lines cross existing lines. Also, each connection must result in at least one new word, which the player claims (they may claim more than one). Words are spelled by following the connections - a connection can be traversed more than once, and each letter has an implicit connection to itself.

After adding as many connections as desired a player ends a turn by adding a new letter with a single connection to an existing letter. This need not result in any new words.

Claimed words score their length minus the minimum word length. However, there are some additional rules on claiming longer forms of earlier words and so forth, which affect the scoring.

After the last letter has been added players may examine the network to find additional words to claim.

Name: Dino Dodge: Survival of the Fittest
Description:
~STORY~
65 million years ago, the Earth was dominated by Dinosaurs. They lived together in peace and harmony. Always being kind and courteous to their dino neighbors. That is…until the meteors came…

Now it’s every dino for themselves! Push, shove and dodge your way out of falling meteors! Do whatever it takes, even if it means moving another dino under the meteor, to be the Last Dinosaur on Earth!

~OBJECTIVE~
Play Action Cards to dodge falling meteors, move your enemies under meteors and avoid new threats. Meteors fall by utilizing its ticker. Whoever is under a meteor and cannot escape are eliminated from the game.

Manage your hand carefully or leave your fate in the claws of your enemies. Meteors continue to fall and the world turns into lava, as the age of extinction lays way for only one dinosaur left standing!

~SPECIFICATION~
AGES: 8 and up
PLAYERS: 2 – 5
DURATION: 15 – 30 minutes
GAMETYPE: Competitive
MECHANICS: Take that, Hand Management, Free-For-All
REPLAYABILITY: Yes

LAUNCHING ON KICKSTARTER SOON:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bluegeargames/dino-dodge-relaunch/

Name: Gin-Go
Description:
In a Rummy style of play, put down your spreads and place your chips to match each placed card. Two opponents (or teams of two) play from either end, in a tit-for-tat strategy trying to knock off each other's chips using card spreads to build a connecting link from their Ace to King row. Build your link, break theirs and hold that link until the hand is played out is what makes Gin-Go an exciting, fun and challenging game.

—description from the designer

Name: Gesund und munter durchs ganze Jahr!
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 52 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: ASL Comp: Cambrai IV – Highlanders Ground
Description:
Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... this is a limited collection and print run.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 required.

Scenarios:
Cantaing, France (5 km south-west of Cambrai)

     Combined Arms, November 21st 1917
     Harlequin, November 21st 1917
     Cantaing Mill, November 21st 1917
     The Kaiser's Navy, September 28th 1918
     Weary Warriors, November 21st 1917
     Distant Objective, November 21st 1917
     Need A Tank, November 21st 1917
     Red, Green and Blue, September 28th 1918

Name: Flames of War: Firestorm Battle – Villers-Bretonneux: 24 - 27 April 1918
Description:
Firestorm: Villers-Bretonneux is the recreation of the Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux.

This battle is famous in military history as the first battle where opposing tanks met.

This is a Firestorm battle (not a Campaign), a battle of 4 days in April, 1918.

Name: Warrior Zone
Description:
Warrior Zone, a game of attrition, where players use the “strategy-of-chance” to gain victory. With each game a different battlefield where players ruthlessly eliminate their opponents. Take your five best warriors into battle, attacking and defending with a unique dice system in both hand-to-hand, short-range, and long-range combat. Gain experience, heal, or feel the wicked wrath of the unexpected.

Be the One To Stand Where All Have Fallen!

—description from publisher

Name: Dawn of Kingdoms
Description:
Dawn of Kingdoms is a worker placement (with a new twist), resource management, tableau building, area control game!

Dawn of Kingdoms is a game that is riveted with intense decisions that are made difficult due to their importance and lasting effects!

Raise your Kingdom to its fullest potential by choosing wisely where to place your two workers each round (1 king and 1 queen). 
After placing their workers everyone collects their respective resources, tokens, points, and building blueprints. They then have an opportunity to build a building from their blueprint collections.

Points can be acquired in a variety of ways. Through area control on the map, hidden victory points from political buildings, from the worker placement board, and from special circumstances due to a constructed building.

—description from the designer

Name: Latino Card Revoked: First Edition
Description:
A hilarious, laugh-out-loud trivia game about Latino culture written by comedians, Glorelys Mora and Tori Pool. 
Whether you identify as Latino, Latina or Latinx - if you can't answer these questions, you might just need your card revoked.

One player reads a question with multiple choice questions, A-D. The others put down a card indicating the choice they believe is correct. Players start with 10 points and lose a point for every incorrect answer.


     Plays up to 6 people 
     Includes 81 question cards
     24 response cards 
     Safe for family play
     Comes in a white box

Name: Surround!
Description:
Surround! is played on any kind of grid; six example grids are provided including standard square, hexagonal, and triangular grids.

On a turn a player colors in one grid space. The object is to completely surround any connected group of spaces of the opposing color (including just a single space) with your own spaces and/or the edge of the grid. Spaces do not connect at the corners.

The game is stated to be intended as an introduction to Go.

Name: Meadow: Robin Promo Card
Description:
Expand your Meadow collection with Robin promo card!

Shuffle Robin into one of decks, try to create a perfect environment for him and add him to your meadow to make it even richer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Meadow: Cards & Sleeves Pack
Description:
Take care of your Meadow and protect it with special card sleeves! The set includes 300 transparent sleeves in Meadow cards size, providing protection from dirt, moisture and loss of color. Additionally, there is an “R” envelope with 6 cards as a mini-expansion to the game!
Cards & Sleeves pack is a language independent expansion for Meadow.

What is Meadow?
Meadow is a board game in which players take the role of wanderers watching nature. Equipped with a map, they stroll through the picturesque surroundings, looking for inspiration and capturing breathtaking views. Players are driven by passion and curiosity, but also by competition for the title of the keenest nature observer! It will be awarded to whoever scores the most points from the observed species of animals and plants, landscapes and souvenirs collected from the hike. Competition continues by the fire, where players compete in achieving the goals of their expeditions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Runes Way
Description:
Runes Way is a deck of 31 hexagonal cards that are designed primarily for playing games in the live action role-playing (LARP) world of Empire which is run by Profound Decisions. Players do not need to know anything about LARP, The Empire or runes to enjoy the games.

Runes Way comes with rules for three quick and simple real-time mini-games designed by The Guild of Good Games called The Way of The Runes, The Runes of The Way and Runic Skein'.  There is a further turn-based solo or cooperative game challenge called Paragon's Path.  The cards can also be combined together into The Runes Way Labyrinth puzzle that forms an elaborate structure with hidden meanings for those who seek its secrets. Finally, the cards may also be used for divination purposes using the Wheel of Meaning method of Rune-Reading.

The Runes Way cards each feature six runes from the world of Empire. One of the runes on each card will match exactly one other rune on any other card - this is a similar feature to that used in the game of Dobble where one symbol on every card matches a symbol on any other card. The Runes Way cards may be placed adjacent to each other to connect matching runes along adjoining edges, enabling cards to be connected into a line - this has similarities to how pieces connect in dominoes.  Since the shapes of many of the runes are very similar, it can be challenging to quickly spot which runes match correctly.

There are 2 similar but slightly different standard editions of the Runes Way deck (the Blood Red Runes Edition and the Empress Lisabetta Memorial Edition).  These may be combined together to increase the number of players who can play the different games, and to add variety and additional challenge to the gameplay.

Name: Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops
Description:
Murder, Mayhem & Lollipops is a darkly comedic competitive card game in which players collect weapons that they will later use to assassinate targets. The player with the highest total value in assassinated targets and unused weapons and other items wins the game.

On a turn, a player must perform 3 actions. This could either be revealing a target, killing a target by spending weapon(s), aqcuire items through flipping a card over or taking them from a deck or another player, or discarding candy to get more actions.

Name: Taelmoor
Description:
Taelmoor is a cooperative dungeon crawling and storytelling game. It ties together physical boards, cards, and standees with a smartphone app using scan-and-play technology. Each scenario typically involves a combination of exploration, puzzle solving, storytelling, and combat in a classic sword and sorcery setting.

Games of Taelmoor begin with players selecting an archetypal class (i.e wizard or rogue), and forming a party by joining the host's game with their smartphone or mobile device. Players then take turns exploring and interacting with the game world. New rooms are laid out tile by tile as they are explored, and each may include unique elements like NPCs to talk to, puzzles to solve, or combat. The story is relayed simultaneously to all players via the app, though players are encouraged to read new passages aloud as they are discovered.

Combat features simplified deck construction elements. Each class has unique strengths and weaknesses, and can build a custom combat deck as they level up throughout a scenario. Strategy between players is emphasized as many attacks become more powerful when combined with others. Attacks are played by scanning the physical card and then discarding.

Scenarios typically take 60-90 minutes to complete. Some are broken into multiple parts and are meant to be played across separate sessions.

Name: Walking a Bloody Path: The Battle of Fallen Timbers, August 20, 1794
Description:
“The trail has been a long and bloody; it has no end. The pale faces come from where the sun rises, and they are many. They are like the leaves on the trees. When the frost comes they fall back and are blown away. But when the sunshine comes again they come back more plentiful than ever before.” –Little Turtle’s remarks, August 14, 1794.

Following defeats in 1790 and 1791 in the Northwest Territory the US Government authorized the creation of a standing army to invade and subdue the area. Appointed in overall command of the force was Revolutionary War here, General Anthony Wayne. Nicknamed “Mad” for his impetuous and daring attacks against the British in that war, General Wayne instead elected for a methodical and remorseless campaign against the Native Americans. Dubbing this new US army a “Legion”, it was divided into for “sub-legions”, each of which was a combined-arms force of regular as well as militia infantry, dragoons, artillery and engineers.

The Legion drilled extensively after forming near Pittsburgh. The force then traveled down the Ohio River and after disembarking in Cincinnati began its march north into the heart of the Native American territory.

Can you do as well, or better? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Walking a Bloody Path is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
96 double-sided, un-mounted counters
One 20 page rules booklet with color illustrations and designer notes.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and determine some game events. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, and can be used with all of the games in the Battles of the Old Northwest Series, is also available. Walking a Bloody Path is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Nils Johansson.

-description from designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Battles of the Old Northwest (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: The War of Cognac
Description:
Between 1526 and 1530 a war broke out in Italy which involved the  Peninsula from Calabria to Lombardy; often inserted as an “episode” of long Italian Wars of XVI century, the conflict comes also referred to as War of Cognac, from the name of the locality where the treaty of alliance and formed the League between Rome, Florence, Venice, Milan and France against the Emperor Charles V.

The conflict was the first real attempt at Italian independence, fought between Italians against Italians, due to the division in which it is he found the country and the mercenary it was rampant practice in those years.

The game is based on the Thirty Years War system published by GMT Games.

During every turn, players alternate in playing cards for action points or for event. Actions points are used to move armies, fight with enemy, siege a fortress, take control of areas.
Some areas are key area that gives the control player Victory Points. At the end of a scenario (smaller or campaign) the player who has the most VPs is the winner.

Name: Top Trumps Quiz: Disney
Description: The Top Trumps Disney version of Winning Moves card game is suitable for children aged 6 and over. Who will be the strongest ? Play with family or friends with this Quiz 500 questions and test your knowledge of the Disney universe.

Name: Zik: Volume II
Description:
Zik: Volume 2 is a party game. Players will have to guess which song is sung by a team mate. But players are not allowed to sing the lyrics, they must use onomatopoeia such as gling-gling, tut, boom etc...

Contents: 48 cards with 384 new songs.

Name: Hein?: Famille & Culture Pop
Description:
In the game Hein? Famille & Culture Pop ("Huh? Family and Pop Culture"), you try to describe songs, people, places or professions in strange and funny ways. Word, mime, song ... describe your films or your personalities as you want. Because your goal is simple: that as few players as possible understand what you are talking about!

The fewer players who understand, the more points you score. But at least one player must understand!

Be careful not to say too much at the risk of a detail giving the answer to too many players and find around the table which players seem to understand you so that you know when to stop. And above all have fun listening to the absurd descriptions of other players.

Name: No panic! Extreme
Description: Draw a theme card, cross your fingers, then spin the wheel. Quick ! You must find as many answers as indicated by the wheel. So avoid at all costs falling on the extreme box! Keep your cool, time is on your side: the faster you will be, the further you will be able to advance on the board. Can be played alone or in teams. With over 1000 crazy questions!

Name: Quizduell Master
Description: The most popular quiz app in Germany can now be played as a board game at master level! Quizduell Master allows up to six players to compete simultaneously at the gaming table with over 1,800 trivia questions of 3 difficulty levels. Players can customize the game to play a traditional quiz duel, play in teams, or compete in tournament mode.

Name: Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold – The Ruins
Description:
This is the expansion made from stretch goals from the Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold Kickstarter campaign.

It is composed of the following market cards:

Gems:
Allaying Shell
Pulsyrium Globe
Rainbow Flourite
Shimmerbead
Witchglass

Relics:
Aether Widget
Contingency Kit
Element Convertor
Ghost Harness
Vim Infuser

Spells:
Accelerating Field
Bestowing Light
Dawn Barrage
Force Bubble
Harmonize
Phantasmagoria
Magnify
Reverse Gravity
Rune Tutor
Stupefy

The Ruins expansion was originally released as part of the Legacy of Gravehold Kickstarter.

Name: The Replay World of International Athletics: Part 1 – The Track Events
Description: Recreate the performances of historic athletes.  Real world data drives the results.  The game system revolves around fluctuating Fitness levels.  Events are resolved swiftly allowing large events to be concluded in a single evening.

Name: The Replay World of International Athletics: Part III – Combined Events
Description:
Building off of parts I (Track Events) and II (Field Events); The Replay World of International Athletics, Part III, covers “Combined Events”.  Specifically this means the Decathlon for male competitors, and the Heptahlon for female athletes.

Included with this part is an official manual of I.A.A.F. And the F.I.A.A. Covering “Scoring Tables for Men’s and Women’s Combined Events Competitions.  This was released for 1985 by these sports sanctioning bodies.

Name: Stunt Kites
Description:
It is a breezy beautiful day, so grab your kite and show off your skills.  You and your opponent will be flying dual-line stunt kites, pulling off spectacular tricks in a timed routine.  Maintain control of the two strings and use the wind to maneuver your kite.  Put on the best show by chaining together tricks and you’ll win the judges over.

Stunt Kites is a 2 player worker placement micro game.  Use your hands to push and pull your kite into position to perform tricks and earn points.  The player that earns the most points by the end of the game wins.

The game is played in rounds and on their turn a player places one of their two Hand cards on a central Pilot card.  These Hand cards act as workers and can block out actions from the other player.  The placement of the worker allows movement and rotation of a player's Kite card on a grid.  If the kite is in the required position and orientation on their grid, they can perform a trick earning them points.  Players can plan to do more tricks but must be careful to not get caught with unperformed tricks at the end of the game as those result in penalties.

When there are no Trick cards left in the Trick deck, the Final Trick is revealed.  When either player lands that trick, they claim it and the game ends immediately.  The player that scored the most points from tricks after applying penalties wins.

—description from the designer
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Monster Stomping: Heroes
Description:
Monster Stomping: Heroes is a card game where you mashup crazy monsters and build epic heroes to battle for your city.

The theme is contemporary superheroes vs. mutant monsters, with a building phase that gradually becomes an attacking and defending phase. The goal is to place six city defense cards around your city for the win.

Players begin by choosing a monster body, and hero body and a city to defend. Then they are dealt five cards and play begins. On their turn players can place a monster power on a monster body, a hero power on a hero body, or a city defense card on a city card, and they can play one special card. When they have a few monster powers on their monster they can instead choose to attack another player's city. They can also take their turn to discard up to their whole hand and pick new cards.

Attacking another city is called "combat" and when that happens both the attacker and defender roll a die, then add the role to their either their monster score (for the attacker) or hero score (for the defender). Then both players can start throwing combat cards which modify the numerical results for either side making the fight go back-and-forth until one player comes out on top with the highest score. If the attacker wins they add the city defense card to their city. If the hero wins they get a bonus to their next defense. There are many combat cards and also special cards which add to the teeter-totter effect that keeps the game neck-and-neck to the end. The game ends when one player manages to place a 6th city defense card around their city, making it impregnable.

-description from designer

Name: Star Fleet Marines: Battle Manual
Description:
Improvise, Adapt, and Overcome!

The pirates have beamed down to the planet. Do they have a secret base? Are they holding hostages? Time to send in the Marines!

The Star Fleet Marines Battle Manual has all the published rules for Star Fleet Marines and the scenarios from the rulebooks in Assault and Last Stand. 
But wait! There’s more!
Every additional scenario written for Star Fleet Marines to date is included. 
Questions and answers about the rules are compiled. 
Find articles on tactics. 
And all of this is in one handy volume instead of paging through magazines or newsletters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Selección Natural
Description:
Selección Natural (Natural Selection) is a competitive game, where you must evolve to survive in a changing world. Choose your creature, and help it to thrive, mutating and evolving into an species better adapted to the environment. This task won´t be easy, as you will face several obstacles, from predators and diseases that may decimate the population, to sudden changes in the environment that will force you to adapt. And if that wasn´t enough, other species are also fighting for survival, thus creating a race for becoming the first one to evolve or to reach a population that dominates over the other species.

Each player starts with a Level 1 Species Card, and three cards in their hand. On your turn, you will take a card from the Mutations & Events Deck, and you will play a card from your hand. It could be a mutation that allows you to increase your population, or an event card that affects your creature or your enemies´. After each player has played a card, mutations are checked. If your mutation matches the current Biome, your population increases. If both mutations are active, congrats! Your creature evolves to Level 2. The game ends when any species reaches the critical population, or evolves to lvl3.

Name: Zero Dark: Operation Nemesis
Description:
This is the first major supplement for the best-selling independent sci-fi skirmish wargame, Horizon Wars: Zero Dark.

Zero Dark: Operation Nemesis tells the story of Bal Anub, a special forces team from the human colony of Venus sent in pursuit of a mystery on the surface of an Earth ravaged by a devastating asteroid strike.  
This book contains new rules for Horizon Wars: Zero Dark, including new heroes and Red Force options, as well as a full 12-mission solo or co-operative campaign and 6 brand new Versus missions for PvP gaming.

You will need Horizon Wars: Zero Dark to use the contents of this publication.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dystopian Wars: Hunt for the Prometheus – 2 Player Starter Set
Description:
Dystopian Wars is a tabletop wargame of naval battles using highly detailed miniatures to represent huge engines of destruction on, above and below the high-seas. Set in an alternate late-Nineteenth Century called the Dystopian Age, super-science fuelled nations clash over resources and power.

Pick your faction and fight for dominance over the seas and skies with incredible machines of war fuelled by extraordinary technology - dread marvels of the Dystopian Age.

Dystopian Wars is set in the Dystopian Age. From the Badlands of North America to the icy realm of Antarctica, the world of the Dystopian Age is a wild and dangerous place.

This box set not only provides everything you need for two players to start playing Dystopian Wars, but it also contains a campaign that details the theft of the prototype Hypatia Class Generator ship by the Russian double agent Helsinki Markov.

The Commonwealth Intelligence Service (known as the Okhrana) have seen a chance to acquire Enlightened secrets and add new technology to their arsenal in order to better defend the Commonwealth. They risk reprisals from the Enlightened but as long as the technology is theirs it would be worth the consequence. The Covenant guard their secrets jealously and losing the Generator ship will cost them years of research and development.

Contents:
    30 Highly Detailed Plastic & Resin Miniatures
        1x 14 Ship Covenant of the Enlightened Fleet
            1x Descartes Class Control Ship
            1x Hypatia Class Generator Ship
            3x Copernicus Class Heavy Cruisers
                Each Cruiser can alternatively be built as either Antarctica, Chatelet, Lovelace, Stiletto or Ulysses Class
            9x Merian Class Drone Frigates
                Each Frigate can alternatively be built as Germain Class
        1x 16 Ship Commonwealth Fleet
            1x Borodino Class Battleship
            5x Kutsov Class Cruisers
                Each Cruiser can alternatively be built as either Norilsk, Oleg or Sineus Class
            10x Rurik Class Frigates
    1x Rule Book
    1x Campaign Book
    2x Victory & Valour card Decks
        60 Cards in each deck
    1x Template Set
    40x Action Dice
    12x Critical Dice
    2x Condition token sets
    1x Iceberg & Physeter Construction Token Set
    3x Medium Bases

Name: Pulp Alley: Core Rules – Second Edition
Description:
Pulp Alley is jam-packed with all the rules needed to bring two-fisted heroes, dastardly villains, and thrilling pulp adventures to your gaming tabletop.

PLAY SOLO, CO-OP, or VERSUS!


     Fast-play rules capture the thrilling pace of the pulps and cliffhanger serials!
     Create your own characters - quick and easy.
     Players never need to consult charts during a scenario. The action is on the tabletop – not in a rulebook.
     Control of the Initiative is based on events as they occur during the scenario rather than arbitrary die-rolls.
     Fights are fast-paced and simultaneously dangerous for both characters, instead of the old I-shoot-then-you-shoot sequence.
     Perils and challenges are unpredictable and have multiple paths to success.
     Scenarios are plot-driven, encouraging action, and offering an array of different rewards.
     Through campaigns and experience your characters can increase their skills and develop new abilities.
     Includes rules for SOLO, CO-OP, VERSUS, loads of options rules, and so much more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Pulp Alley: Scenarios – Second Edition
Description:
Pulp Alley 2nd Ed: Scenarios

This book includes the first twelve Scenarios of the Month - previously only available as separate downloadable files.

This book includes basic scenario set-up and wrap-up rules.

In addition, you will find the rules for Solo, Horror, NPCs, and so on, for quick and easy reference. 
The scenario pages focus mainly on the rules and special cards.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Mixtape Massacre: Invasion – Plasma Gun promo card
Description:
Time for a Bug Hunt!

Text says:
Target any slasher or invader card on the board from any distance.
Stats +9/+1/2

Blast your enemies with this powerful Kickstarter Exclusive Supply card, available in very limited quantities from the publisher's website.

Name: Mixtape Massacre: Escape From Tall Oaks – Revenge Pack
Description:
Four classic slashers (Dr. Ravenous, Thorne, Hatchling, and Stitches) return to Tall Oaks for revenge. Look out kids, they’re coming for you!

This pack brings 4 classic slashers back for use in Escape from Tall Oaks as optional enemies to mix into your rogue gallery.

WHAT’S IN THE REVENGE PACK?
4 New Slasher character pieces
4 Slasher Profile cards for use with Escape From Tall Oaks

-description from publisher's website

Name: Mixtape Massacre: The Scare Booster Pack
Description:
“They say the town of Tall Oaks was founded on a massacre brought to the region by its settlers. An evil history that runs deep through the roots of its grounds. Every Halloween, this evil manifests into a vessel of revenge for the victims of Tall Oaks’ dark history. The Scare has emerged from the field of Johnson’s Farm to pull the town back into the soil.”

WHAT’S IN A BOOSTER PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card
1 Slasher Profile card (for use with Escape From Tall Oaks)"

-description from publisher's website

Name: Mixtape Massacre: The Sleigher Booster Pack
Description:
“Rotten! Rotten souls, all of them,” a voice kept whispering to Bruce as he sat there in his Santa outfit awaiting the excited children of Tall Oaks Mall. No matter how hard he tried, he couldn’t shake this feeling something was coming over him. As the kids came and went, the voice got louder and louder. Suddenly a local girl screamed, “Look! Santa has horns!” It was too late. Bruce was gone and in his place, was something feral…

WHAT’S IN A BOOSTER PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card
1 Slasher Profile card (for use with Escape From Tall Oaks)"

-description from publisher's website

Name: Mixtape Massacre: Bad Dad Booster Pack
Description:
After making a “killing” on Wall Street, Joe decided it was time to take a break from big city life and settle down. Within a year of his arrival to Tall Oaks, Joe met Gwen and her two daughters and decided maybe he’d take a stab at family life. Three months into the marriage, family life quickly grew dull, and Joe was itching to have some fun again. It was time for a night on the town… right after he put Gwen and the kids to bed.

WHAT’S IN A BOOSTER PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card"

-description from publisher's website

Name: Mixtape Massacre: Scarlett Booster Pack
Description:
Never ride in cars with strange boys… and never follow said boys into the caves. Sadly, Scarlett was never one for the rules and after a night in the caves of Tall Oaks, she awoke with a nasty hickey and a horrible aversion to sunlight. She should have sought help, but as night fell, she developed an insatiable hunger. So she went out for a BITE…

WHAT’S IN THE PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card"

-description from publisher's website

Name: Freight Frenzy
Description:
Fun medium-light weight pickup-and-deliver game, where the board is always different, and your available routes change during the game.

In the future, after the fiasco of Monorail public transportation, logistics companies acquire the infrastructure cheaply, and use it to deliver cargo, instead of passengers.
Players are route planners for one of those logistics companies, competing to gain manifests (contracts), picking up the corresponding package/s first to then deliver them to their requested destination.
Each turn you use your monorail's speed for available actions to load, unload, and move, with the goal of acquiring contracts and delivering the most packages.
Old passenger routes are not optimal for cargo, however, so over the course of the game you can change the tracks, improving your routes or hindering other players'. You can also improve your monorail, increasing your package capacity per trip, or making it faster, which gives you more actions per turn.

Gameplay:
- The board game is setup randomly out of different track tiles. Cargo packages are set on 9 stations around the board.
- Each player has an action allowance, based on their monorail's speed. This can increase or decrease in later turns, as players buy more engines or more cargo space for their monorails.
- Routes can be improved (or hindered) by using track improvements, which allow players replace the track tiles on the board.
- New contracts are created randomly from cargo + destination decks.
- The game ends when all “golden” packages are delivered. The player that successfully delivered the most valuable packages is the winner.

The game can be played from 2 to 5 players.

-description from designer

Name: Absedio
Description:
ABSEDIO is an abstract game for two players.

It takes place on three boards simultaneously, each board initially has four white pieces and four black pieces, and in the center of each of them, a Skull.

The players, in turn, must make two movements (NEVER on the same board).

The objective of the game is to immobilize the claws of the three boards with as many of your own pieces as possible.

Name: Game of Hunt
Description:
Game of Hunt includes four different family board games in one book with magnetic components. All games are fully cooperative, each has its own story and different rules. Players work together, move around the maps and pick up objects by using the cards.

In the "Trash monster" game players will be cleaning the town hunting trash cubes until they pick them all. Trash cubes are thrown by a cute flying monster who takes turns after each player's turn.

In the "Mushroom forest" game players help small gnomes to pick up enough mushrooms for the soup. However, the forest is magical and some mushrooms can teleport a player to a completely different place.

In the "Another planet" game players travel to a different galaxy and help a friendly alien to collect all the resources. Mind the wind forecast since it blows players away after each player's turn.

In the "Monkey temple" game players go to the ancient temple full of strange moving monkey statues. The treasure will be players reward if they find a way to stop all of the statues.

-description from designer

Name: Foul Play: The Manor House Murder
Description:
Welcome to Edwardian England. The Lord of the Manor is dead! The servants are our lead suspects and it's up to you to unearth the evidence, seek out the suspects and catch the culprit in order to scupper the other sleuths, and win this game of murder! There's more than one way to catch a killer though. So what's it gonna be? Good Cop or Bad Cop? These two game versions come with their own set of rules and tactics to crack the case and finger your suspect, but will you use fair play or FOUL PLAY?

The Game is Afoot! Playing as detective, you’ll need to find the three evidence cards that point to a specific suspect in order to catch a killer in this crazy criminal caper. Will you uncover them in the crime scene? Could the other detectives be willing to collaborate and share their findings? Or will you resort to more tricky tactics, and plunder the proof you need to solve this crime?

Detectives (players) have to deduce information from the Evidence Locker and Crime Scene to solve the murder.

The game has Two Playing Variants:

Good Cop (Catch A Killer) - set-up by placing the Evidence cards face down according to color and shuffle each pile. The remaining cards form the Evidence Locker. Add one card from each Evidence pile into the Evidence Locker and discard the rest. Shuffle the Evidence Locker and 9 cards into a 3x3 grid (The Crime Scene) in the center of the playing area. Deal 5 cards face down to each player. Then place the remaining Evidence Locker, face down, to one side of the Crime Scene.

Bad Cop (Frame a suspect) All cards are in play - so shuffle the full deck and then follow the same set up as Good Cop, deal 7 cards to each player and you're ready to go.

Detectives play the game by discarding or playing cards on their turn, choosing between fair and foul play cards. The winner is the Detective who determines who the murderer is and has the killer in their hand when making an accusation.

Name: Coach Kim Stewart's Checker Football
Description:
Coach Kim Stewart's Checker Football is designed to simulate the game of football as closely as possible. It allows for football actions such as blocking, running, moving the ball, passing, or punting. The board itself is designed to resemble a football field with two end zones. The checkers represent the players with the offense having eleven players and the defense having twelve players. There is also a quarterback, which is supposedly the most powerful game piece of any board game that the designer has ever seen.

—user summary

Name: Smash Up: È Colpa Vostra! & Big in Japan
Description:
Two in one! "It's Your Fault" and "Big in Japan" for double the fun!

The factions of It's Your Fault were chosen, through a contest, by players from all over the world, while Big in Japan is inspired by Japanese pop culture. Each combination of decks will have different and devastating effects.
 Mix these decks into the base game and start an epochal battle for domination of the universe!

Name: Wer macht einen Fünfer?
Description: The players have 5 pawns each and start at space A. The first to reach space 90 with all 5 pawns wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Xodul
Description:
This game is a variant of chess inspired by international chess, shogi, and xiangqi. The differences from chess are:
1. the board is 8x9, where the startup position contains the traditional pieces at left hand-side and the additional pieces at right hand-side;
2. various additional pieces were introduced:
    - a wizard piece which can teleport or move two squares diagonally
    - a guard piece which moves one square orthogonally or various squares along its row/column in the direction of the king up to the maximum of intercepting the coordinates of the king
    - a lance piece which can move any number of squares forward or diagonally one space
    - a cannon piece which is the same as its counterpart in xiangqi
    (note: the chess rook was replaced by a xiangqi car, which has the same movement)
3. pawns can be promoted by replacing it with a captured piece;
4. pawns are promoted to generals upon reaching the last line, which moves one square to the front or diagonally.

Name: Crusades: A Solo Game
Description:
After a disastrous battle you command a small group of Crusaders fleeing the Saracen forces.

Ideal for individually based 28mm figures but other sized figures would also work.

A simple and easy to play solo game with enough variables to allow it to be replayed many times.

—description from the publisher

Turn Sequence:
1- Crusaders move, fight etc..
2- Saracen forces move fight etc..
3- Roll for Saracen reinforcements starting on turn 2
4- Roll for random events

Name: Sherwood Bandits: The 5th Player
Description:
Components for adding a fifth player to Sherwood Bandits:

    1 Gang Leader
    4 Bandits
    4 Dice
    3 New Wagons
    3D Chest

Name: Bullet: Orange
Description:
Bullet: Orange is a new expansion for Bullet♥ï¸. Bullet: Orange brings 4 new heroines to the game, and represents the first tabletop appearance of famous characters from the Orange Juice franchise, with characters from top-rated Orange Juice titles Sora, Flying Red Barrel, SUGURI, and QP-shooting - Dangerous!! all making appearances in the new game.

-description from the publisher

Name: Золотая лихорадка
Description:
Ð—Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ñ‚Ð°Ñ Ð»Ð¸Ñ…Ð¾Ñ€Ð°Ð´ÐºÐ°, Gold fever

Attracted by the secrets of ancient civilizations, by treasures hidden by the thick walls of temples? 
Feel like a seeker of the mysterious treasures of the past. 
Find the right path to the treasure, bypass all the obstacles and dead ends, and most importantly, remember the basic rule: "You can not trust anyone!"

How to play?
Players act as treasure hunters of the ancient temple, but among them, skillfully disguising themselves, the Guardians of the temple can hide. 
The task of the treasure hunters is to study the intricacies of the tunnels in the temple, to build a route to the treasures, avoiding the traps and intrigues of the Guardians. 
The goal of the Temple Guardians is not to betray themselves. Make sure that treasure hunters do not get to the Treasury.

The player who receives the most gold after three rounds of the game wins.

– translated description

Name: Gudetama: The Lazy Card Game
Description:
In this game featuring the lazy egg character Gudetama, players start with 6 face down cards in front of them, called their "plate." The cards are either a numbered card, from -2 through 9, or one of the 10 Breakfast Special cards which allow actions such as revealing or peeking at cards. On their turn, players replace cards from their plate or take cards from the Draw pile.

Players want to get their cards to add up the lowest possible amount by the end of the round, in order to win a Bacon Blanket. The first player to collect three Bacon Blankets wins the game.

Name: Sudokan
Description:
Sudokan is a flip and draw thinky filler game, with a unique twist fighting mechanism.

The players are Daimyos who are summoned by the Emperor to protect the kingdom from the barbarians. They must use the Sudokan, a forgotten art of encrypted military strategies and send it to the Emperor to be evaluated.

Players must draw monks, clans and Toriis to create the best strategy. Every round will have battles and they need to choose carefully which regions they want to fight to win. Because you can´t win it all.

Besides that, the Daimyos must pay attention to the Emperor impositions which along with battles, also give victory points.

In the end of the game, the player with the most victory points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: O Cortiço
Description:
Based on the classic novel.

In this game, each player becomes João Romão, owning his own tenement and striving to build houses, rent, negotiate, set fire and avoid fires, traps and confrontations with rival groups.

Play and have fun to better understand the occupation of geographical spaces, the social and cultural formation of Brazil, and, above all, to immerse yourself in the literary universe of Aluísio Azevedo.

Every turn you can use 3 types of cards: properties, tenants and action to earn money. The game ends when a player accumulates (the same sum of money the character in the book is seeking to accumulate). The player with most money at the end wins.

—user summary

Name: Flea Collared
Description:
Flea Collared is a Checkers-like game played on a 10x8 board with two different types of pieces: dogs and fleas. Each player controls eight dogs and four fleas.

Dogs and fleas both move in standard Checkers fashion, moving and jumping forwards. Dogs can be promoted to "top dogs" which can move backwards as well. Jumping is mandatory.

The game can be won by capturing all your opponent's dogs, but also by forcing your opponent to capture all your fleas or move one of their fleas to your end of the board.

Name: Witches' Quarrel: Gifted Children
Description:
Witches' Quarrel is a 2 player, 10-minute deckbuilder with legacy mechanics, where you play the role of a witch in a quarrel with another witch.

Play spells to gain power, learn new spells, and deal or block damage. The first witch to take 10 damage loses.

Play each game with a selection of 5 changing spells, but all the spells start in sealed envelopes: complete achievements to unlock each spell. Also unlock new witch characters and new starting spell options for each witch.

Find a new snippet of lore about the child prodigies Yi-Feng and Nitya and the magical world they live in with each envelope.

—description from the publisher
